alert.note: Alert for Eastern Marion; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central St. Johns, northeastern Marion, Putnam, eastern Clay and south central Duval Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1243 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bellair-Meadowbrook Terrace to near Salt Springs. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palatka, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Pomona Park, East Palatka, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Salt Springs, Lake Delancy and Doctors Inlet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Marion; Western Clay; Western Putnam
